newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNAIR SETS NEW FLIGHTS TO DUBLIN, TROMSOE.
newsitem.headline: FINNAIR SETS NEW FLIGHTS TO DUBLIN, TROMSOE.

text.p: Finnish national carrier Finnair Oy said in a statement on Wednesday it would start new regular international scheduled flights to Dublin and Tromsoe in spring and increase its flights to Stockholm and Copenhagen.
Finnair said it would fly the Helsinki-Stockholm-Dublin route three times per week starting May 1. The flight would be in code-sharing with Irish Aer Lingus .
Bi-weekly flights to Tromsoe in northern Norway would start on June 21 on the Helsinki-Rovaniemi-Enontekio-Tromsoe route. Rovaniemi and Enontekio are cities in northern Finland.
From April 28, Finnair would start in code-sharing with Danish Maersk Air, part of A.P. Moller Gruppen, eight daily flights between Stockholm and Copenhagen.
Finnair said it had started direct flights between the Finnish north-west coast city of Oulu and Stockholm from March 9. --Helsinki newsroom +358-9-680 50 245, e-mail news@reuters.fi
